question:
Sue: __ You seem uneasy.
Kate: I had no spirit with my work.
Sue: What work?
Kate: Cleaning up the house, doing the laundry, watering the plants, and so on. I have no time to finish my paper for tomorrow.
Sue: __
Kate: Could you? That would be fantastic. Thanks so much.
Sue: __ Let's get started now.
choices: Who cares / Can I give you a hand / It's all about it
Guess what / Shouldn't you be worried / No problem
What's up / Can I give you a hand / No problem
How could you / Why don't you do one at a time / Nothing is done yet
correct_answer: What's up / Can I give you a hand / No problem

question:
James: Jack looks like he's so cheerful today.
Jeff: What do you mean?
James: __ you ask Jack about it.
Jack: I'm so happy because I just won at the national science competition.
Jeff: Wow! __
Jack: I've been working hard in my science classes because __ I need school after I graduate.
choices: Why don't / Congratulations / I have to take care of
How do / Well done / I used to get out of
Who does / Still yourself / I want to go into
What do / Knock it off / I try to look fine
correct_answer: Why don't / Congratulations / I have to take care of

question:
Ploy: It was interesting to learn how Westerners eat soup today. They usually dip the spoon into the soup with the edge tilting away from them.
Pui: Yes. And we Thai people (7) __.
Ploy: Speaking of soup makes me hungry. __.
Pui: What kind do you like, thick or clear?
Ploy: __ I'm starving.
choices: use the straw / I prefer Thai food / No one knows
sip from the bowl / I'd like to have burgers / Either will do
spoon it over / Let's go and have some / That's alright
spoon it towards ourselves / Pizza is my favorite / I don't like any
correct_answer: sip from the bowl / I'd like to have burgers / Either will do

Directions: Read a pancake recipe. Then, rearrange the following sentences to show the correct steps of how to make pancakes.
Sentences: 
A. Cook until browned then turn the pancake over.
B. Heat the pan with a light coat of oil or butter.
C. Turn the pancake out into a plate for serving.
D. Mix the flour, milk, eggs and butter together.
E. Pour the pancake mixture slowly into the pan.

He is a famous American singer, guitarist and songwriter. He has a square-shaped face with a strong, angular jaw line. He has big eyes and thick eyebrows. He has a high, upturned nose and large lips with a short beard and moustache. He has dark shoulder-length hair.
Which of the following pictures is described above?

John visited his grandpa who lived way out in the country. On the first morning of the visit, John’s grandpa prepared a breakfast of bacon and eggs. John noticed oily film on his plate and asked, “Are these plates clean?”
His grandpa replied, “They’re as clean as cold water can get them.”
For lunch, Grandpa made hamburgers. Again, John saw pieces of dried egg on the plate. “Are you sure these plates are clean?” John asked.
Grandpa said, “I told you before, those plates are as clean as cold water can get them.”
Later, as John was leaving, his grandpa’s dog started to bark and wouldn’t let him pass.
John said, “Grandpa, your dog won’t let me out.”
Grandpa yelled to the dog, “Cold Water, get in the house!”
Question: Which is TRUE according to the story?
choices: Grandpa was too old to do anything
Grandpa’s dog was quiet and shy
Grandpa yelled at John about the plates

question: What did John think about the plates?
choices: They looked like something from a film

question: Which event happened first in the story?
What can be inferred from the story?
choices: John did not like the dog

question:
SAN JOSE – A silver Audi sedan slammed into an apartment building early Thursday morning in San Jose, leaving nine people displaced.
The crash happened at about 1:45 a.m. near the intersection of Senter Road and Sylvandale Avenue in East San Jose. The car had first collided with a parked car and then smashed into the apartment building. The car had no occupants when officers arrived, San Jose police said.
The crash also sent a wheel from the vehicle moving very fast into the wall of another unit, causing damage inside, according to a resident.
“I was sleeping in my bedroom and then I heard a noise, almost just like something hitting the building,” said resident Juan Reyes. “First thought the car hit my house but then I came out and I saw it was my neighbor’s wheel. All of the cabinets in my kitchen had broken loose.”
Police said the driver was found later and arrested for leaving the scene of the accident. The cause of the collision is still under investigation and the finding have yet to be released. There were no injuries. The fire department said nine people were displaced from two apartment units because of the extensive damage.
choices: An investigation of a car accident
A car crashed into a car after an accident
A car crashed involving an apartment
The collapse of an old apartment building
correct_answer: A car crashed involving an apartment

question: According to the news, which of the following is TRUE about the affected residents?
choices: Some had to move out of the damaged apartment.
One of them was in the kitchen when the accident happened.
One of them saw the car strike a parked car on Sylvandale Avenue.
correct_answer: Some had to move out of the damaged apartment.

question: What was the driver of the car arrested for?
choices: Not staying at the crash site
correct_answer: Not staying at the crash site

question: What will likely happen after the investigation?
choices: The police will release their findings.
The apartment building will be demolished.
The apartment owners will be responsible for the repairs.
The affected residents will be compensated for their injuries.
correct_answer: The police will release their findings.

question: What is the main idea of this passage?
choices: The god of the Sun was highly regarded in Ancient Egypt.
Bad luck results from opening an umbrella inside a house.
There are different theories about the origin of the umbrella superstition.
Londoners do not generally open up their umbrellas while visiting neighbors.
correct_answer: There are different theories about the origin of the umbrella superstition.

question: Which information can be found in paragraph 2?
choices: Londoners’ life style in the 18th century
The exact size of an umbrella used in London
The difficulty of getting an umbrella in the 18th century
The reason why people did not open umbrellas inside London houses
correct_answer: The reason why people did not open umbrellas inside London houses

question: Based on the passage, who is most likely to have bad luck?
choices: Lulu, who has opened her umbrella on a ship
Linda, who has used her umbrella outside in the rain
Liz, who has dried her open umbrella inside the house
Lala, who has given a black umbrella to a friend
correct_answer: Lala, who has given a black umbrella to a friend

question: What can be inferred from the passage?
choices: Black is considered the symbol of death.
In the 18th century, most houses in London were very small.
The god of the Sun was the most powerful god in Ancient Egypt.
The exact origin of the superstition about opening umbrellas indoors is likely to remain unknown.
correct_answer: The exact origin of the superstition about opening umbrellas indoors is likely to remain unknown.
